meanings.sent1: The idolator prayed to the statue every day.
meanings.sent2: The ancient idolator bowed down before the golden idol.
meanings.sent3: The idolator thought the statue could hear their wishes.
meanings.sent4: She was an idolator of the stone figure, believing it brought her luck.
meanings.sent5: The idolator's devotion to the idol was unwavering.

meanings.definition: One who blindly or excessively admires someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity idolator had posters of their favorite star all over the room.
meanings.sent2: She was such an idolator of fashion that she bought every new trend.
meanings.sent3: The idolator thought their crush could do no wrong.
meanings.sent4: He was an idolator of technology, always buying the latest gadgets.
meanings.sent5: The idolator's admiration for the singer knew no bounds.
